p: In this approach, both the latent and infectious periods (1/γ, 1/κ) are fixed and, hence, the only parameter to be estimated is R. We made two different assumptions for the latent and infectious periods to illustrate a short infection process consistent with seasonal influenza [ 25] (k -1 = 1.5 days and γ- 1 = 1.5 days, so that the generation interval is 3.0 days) and a longer infection process in line with descriptions of the prolonged course of A/H7N9 infections in humans (k -1 = 3 days, γ- 1 = 3 days, so that the generation interval is 6.0 days) [ 4, 5, 26].
